analysis.name: Find Duplicate Rows
analysis.script:
from random import randint
#
# output only rows that are duplicated.  Duplicate means each value of each field is the same between two 
# different rows

# input: table
# output: duplcateTable

savedRows = []
tableRowCount = len(table['rows'])
inrows = table['rows']
outColumns = []
outstring = ''

# this routine is called whenever two rows match.  It checks to see if this
# row has been discovered before and outputs it just once.  A record is kept for
# both matching indices so the row will only be output once, even if it occurs multiple
# times in the source table
#
 
def saveRowTheFirstTimeOnly(i,j,inrow):
    global outColumns
    if (i not in savedRows) and (j not in savedRows):
        outColumns.append(inrow)
    if i not in savedRows:
        savedRows.append(i)
    if j not in savedRows:
        savedRows.append(j)

# loop the number of times in the output row count; selecting a random row each time
for i in range(tableRowCount):
    for j in range(tableRowCount):
        if i ==j:
            match = False
        else:
            match = True
            for attrib in inrows[i].keys():
                # bitwise AND to make sure if any attributes don't agree, the match=False
                outstring += 'comparing '+str(inrows[i][attrib])+' and '+str(inrows[j][attrib])+'; '
                match = match and (inrows[i][attrib] == inrows[j][attrib])
                if match:
                    outstring += 'match is True\n'
                else:
                    outstring += 'match is False\n'
        if match:
            saveRowTheFirstTimeOnly(i,j,inrows[j])
    
duplicateTable = {}
duplicateTable['fields'] = table['fields']
duplicateTable['rows'] = outColumns
